official-title.#text:
To ensure fairness in premium rates for coverage for business properties and second homes under the
			 National Flood Insurance Program, and for other purposes.

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Flood Insurance Premium Parity Act of 2014

short-title.#text: Flood Insurance Premium Parity Act of 2014

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Paragraph (2) of section 1307(a) of the National Flood Insurance Act of 1968

header.#text: Repeal of prohibition on subsidized rates

quote.#text:
nor the secondary residence of the owner of the property, and the Administrator shall establish
			 standards for a residential property to qualify for purposes of this
			 subparagraph as a secondary residence that shall (A) require the owner of
			 the property to occupy the property for a minimum period of time each
			 year, as the Administrator determines appropriate, and (B) provide that
			 only a single property of any owner may so qualify

text.#text: by inserting before the semicolon at the end the following:

quote.#tail: after the semicolon at the end;

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Paragraph (4) of section 1308(e) of the National Flood Insurance Act of 1968

header.#text: Conforming amendments relating to limitation on annual rate increases

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: (in this subsection referred to as the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Administrator of the Federal Emergency Management Agency

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Flood Insurance Premium Parity Act of 2014/s:2/ss:a

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: as if such subsections were enacted as part of the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Flood Insurance Premium Parity Act of 2014/s:2/ss:b

quote.#tail: ) shall make available such rate tables, as necessary to implement the amendments made by

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Biggert-Waters Flood Insurance Reform Act of 2012
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Biggert-Waters Flood Insurance Reform Act of 2012

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall consult with Write Your Own companies throughout the
			 development of guidance and rate tables necessary to implement the
			 amendments made by

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Flood Insurance Premium Parity Act of 2014/s:2/ss:a
Flood Insurance Premium Parity Act of 2014/s:2/ss:b

text.#text: To ensure the participation of Write Your Own companies (as such term is defined in

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
section
			 100202(a) of the Biggert-Waters Flood Insurance Reform Act of 2012
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Biggert-Waters Flood Insurance Reform Act of 2012/s:100202/ss:a

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall issue final guidance and rate tables necessary to implement the amendments
			 made by

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Flood Insurance Premium Parity Act of 2014/s:2/ss:a

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
not later than eight months following the
			 date of the enactment of this Act. Write Your Own companies, in
			 coordination with the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Flood Insurance Premium Parity Act of 2014/s:2/ss:b

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, shall have not
			 less than six months but not more than eight months following the issuance
			 of such final guidance and rate tables to implement the changes required
			 by such final guidance and rate tables.

shall refund directly to insureds any premiums for flood insurance coverage under
			 the National Flood Insurance Program collected in excess of the rates
			 required under the amendments made by

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Flood Insurance Premium Parity Act of 2014/s:2/ss:a

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
. To allow
			 for necessary and appropriate implementation of such amendments, any
			 premium changes necessary to implement such amendments, including any such
			 premium refund due to policy holders, which shall be paid directly by the
			 National Flood Insurance Program, shall not be charged or paid to
			 policyholders by the National Flood Insurance Program until after the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Flood Insurance Premium Parity Act of 2014/s:2/ss:b

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
issues guidance and makes available such rate tables to
